events.description: Release of Indonesia's annual economic growth data for 2025, showing 5.11% growth.
Upcoming release of Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves for January.
Cumulative 150bp interest rate cut implemented by Bank Indonesia since September 2024.

facts.fact_text: The Indonesian rupiah weakened toward IDR 16,830 per dollar on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: The Indonesian rupiah weakened toward IDR 16,830 per dollar on Thursday, continuing its decline from the prior session.

facts.fact_text: Indonesia’s economy grew 5.11% in 2025, missing the government's 5.2% target.

evidences.evidence_text: fresh data showed Indonesia’s economy grew 5.11% in 2025, falling short of the government’s 5.2% target

facts.fact_text: Bank Indonesia has cut rates by a cumulative 150bp since September 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: even after a cumulative 150bp cut since September 2024

facts.fact_text: The dollar index reached a near two-week high.

evidences.evidence_text: the dollar index climbed to a near two-week high

claims.claim_text: Markets scaled back expectations for the pace of potential Fed rate cuts.

evidences.evidence_text: markets scaled back expectations for the pace of potential Fed rate cuts

claims.claim_text: Bank Indonesia may have room to ease policy further this year.

evidences.evidence_text: The outcome reinforced bets that Bank Indonesia may have room to ease policy further this year

claims.claim_text: A move toward IDR 15,000 per dollar is achievable under supportive policy measures.
claims.author: Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa

evidences.evidence_text: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, who said a move toward IDR 15,000 per dollar is achievable under supportive policy measures

claims.claim_text: Indonesian economic output remains below potential.
claims.author: Bank Indonesia

evidences.evidence_text: it has emphasized the need to support growth amid views that output remains below potential

evidence.evidence_text: The move largely tracked a firmer greenback, as the dollar index climbed to a near two-week high
The outcome reinforced bets that Bank Indonesia may have room to ease policy further this year
a move toward IDR 15,000 per dollar is achievable under supportive policy measures
the dollar index climbed to a near two-week high after markets scaled back expectations for the pace of potential Fed rate cuts
